Browse the source code of codebrowser/gtsam/3rdparty/cephes/cephes/hyp2f1.c

1/* hyp2f1.c
2 *
3 * Gauss hypergeometric function F
4 * 2 1
5 *
6 *
7 * SYNOPSIS:
8 *
9 * double a, b, c, x, y, hyp2f1();
10 *
11 * y = hyp2f1( a, b, c, x );
12 *
13 *
14 * DESCRIPTION:
15 *
16 *
17 * hyp2f1( a, b, c, x ) = F ( a, b; c; x )
18 * 2 1
19 *
20 * inf.
21 * - a(a+1)...(a+k) b(b+1)...(b+k) k+1
22 * = 1 + > ----------------------------- x .
23 * - c(c+1)...(c+k) (k+1)!
24 * k = 0
25 *
26 * Cases addressed are
27 * Tests and escapes for negative integer a, b, or c
28 * Linear transformation if c - a or c - b negative integer
29 * Special case c = a or c = b
30 * Linear transformation for x near +1
31 * Transformation for x < -0.5
32 * Psi function expansion if x > 0.5 and c - a - b integer
33 * Conditionally, a recurrence on c to make c-a-b > 0
34 *
35 * x < -1 AMS 15.3.7 transformation applied (Travis Oliphant)
36 * valid for b,a,c,(b-a) != integer and (c-a),(c-b) != negative integer
37 *
38 * x >= 1 is rejected (unless special cases are present)
39 *
40 * The parameters a, b, c are considered to be integer
41 * valued if they are within 1.0e-14 of the nearest integer
42 * (1.0e-13 for IEEE arithmetic).
43 *
44 * ACCURACY:
45 *
46 *
47 * Relative error (-1 < x < 1):
48 * arithmetic domain # trials peak rms
49 * IEEE -1,7 230000 1.2e-11 5.2e-14
50 *
51 * Several special cases also tested with a, b, c in
52 * the range -7 to 7.
53 *
54 * ERROR MESSAGES:
55 *
56 * A "partial loss of precision" message is printed if
57 * the internally estimated relative error exceeds 1^-12.
58 * A "singularity" message is printed on overflow or
59 * in cases not addressed (such as x < -1).
60 */
61
62/*
63 * Cephes Math Library Release 2.8: June, 2000
64 * Copyright 1984, 1987, 1992, 2000 by Stephen L. Moshier
65 */
66
67#include <assert.h>
68#include <math.h>
69#include <stdlib.h>
70
71#include "mconf.h"
72
73#define EPS 1.0e-13
74#define EPS2 1.0e-10
75
76#define ETHRESH 1.0e-12
77
78#define MAX_ITERATIONS 10000
79
80extern double MACHEP;
81
82/* hys2f1 and hyp2f1ra depend on each other, so we need this prototype */
83static double hyp2f1ra(double a, double b, double c, double x, double *loss);
84
85/* Defining power series expansion of Gauss hypergeometric function */
86/* The `loss` parameter estimates loss of significance */
87static double hys2f1(double a, double b, double c, double x, double *loss) {
88 double f, g, h, k, m, s, u, umax;
89 int i;
90 int ib, intflag = 0;
91
92 if (fabs(x: b) > fabs(x: a)) {
93 /* Ensure that |a| > |b| ... */
94 f = b;
95 b = a;
96 a = f;
97 }
98
99 ib = round(x: b);
100
101 if (fabs(x: b - ib) < EPS && ib <= 0 && fabs(x: b) < fabs(x: a)) {
102 /* .. except when `b` is a smaller negative integer */
103 f = b;
104 b = a;
105 a = f;
106 intflag = 1;
107 }
108
109 if ((fabs(x: a) > fabs(x: c) + 1 || intflag) && fabs(x: c - a) > 2 && fabs(x: a) > 2) {
110 /* |a| >> |c| implies that large cancellation error is to be expected.
111 *
112 * We try to reduce it with the recurrence relations
113 */
114 return hyp2f1ra(a, b, c, x, loss);
115 }
116
117 i = 0;
118 umax = 0.0;
119 f = a;
120 g = b;
121 h = c;
122 s = 1.0;
123 u = 1.0;
124 k = 0.0;
125 do {
126 if (fabs(x: h) < EPS) {
127 *loss = 1.0;
128 return INFINITY;
129 }
130 m = k + 1.0;
131 u = u * ((f + k) * (g + k) * x / ((h + k) * m));
132 s += u;
133 k = fabs(x: u); /* remember largest term summed */
134 if (k > umax) umax = k;
135 k = m;
136 if (++i > MAX_ITERATIONS) { /* should never happen */
137 *loss = 1.0;
138 return (s);
139 }
140 } while (s == 0 || fabs(x: u / s) > MACHEP);
141
142 /* return estimated relative error */
143 *loss = (MACHEP * umax) / fabs(x: s) + (MACHEP * i);
144
145 return (s);
146}
147
148/* Apply transformations for |x| near 1 then call the power series */
149static double hyt2f1(double a, double b, double c, double x, double *loss) {
150 double p, q, r, s, t, y, w, d, err, err1;
151 double ax, id, d1, d2, e, y1;
152 int i, aid, sign;
153
154 int ia, ib, neg_int_a = 0, neg_int_b = 0;
155
156 ia = round(x: a);
157 ib = round(x: b);
158
159 if (a <= 0 && fabs(x: a - ia) < EPS) { /* a is a negative integer */
160 neg_int_a = 1;
161 }
162
163 if (b <= 0 && fabs(x: b - ib) < EPS) { /* b is a negative integer */
164 neg_int_b = 1;
165 }
166
167 err = 0.0;
168 s = 1.0 - x;
169 if (x < -0.5 && !(neg_int_a || neg_int_b)) {
170 if (b > a)
171 y = pow(x: s, y: -a) * hys2f1(a, b: c - b, c, x: -x / s, loss: &err);
172
173 else
174 y = pow(x: s, y: -b) * hys2f1(a: c - a, b, c, x: -x / s, loss: &err);
175
176 goto done;
177 }
178
179 d = c - a - b;
180 id = round(x: d); /* nearest integer to d */
181
182 if (x > 0.9 && !(neg_int_a || neg_int_b)) {
183 if (fabs(x: d - id) > EPS) {
184 int sgngam;
185
186 /* test for integer c-a-b */
187 /* Try the power series first */
188 y = hys2f1(a, b, c, x, loss: &err);
189 if (err < ETHRESH) goto done;
190 /* If power series fails, then apply AMS55 #15.3.6 */
191 q = hys2f1(a, b, c: 1.0 - d, x: s, loss: &err);
192 sign = 1;
193 w = lgam_sgn(x: d, sign: &sgngam);
194 sign *= sgngam;
195 w -= lgam_sgn(x: c - a, sign: &sgngam);
196 sign *= sgngam;
197 w -= lgam_sgn(x: c - b, sign: &sgngam);
198 sign *= sgngam;
199 q *= sign * exp(x: w);
200 r = pow(x: s, y: d) * hys2f1(a: c - a, b: c - b, c: d + 1.0, x: s, loss: &err1);
201 sign = 1;
202 w = lgam_sgn(x: -d, sign: &sgngam);
203 sign *= sgngam;
204 w -= lgam_sgn(x: a, sign: &sgngam);
205 sign *= sgngam;
206 w -= lgam_sgn(x: b, sign: &sgngam);
207 sign *= sgngam;
208 r *= sign * exp(x: w);
209 y = q + r;
210
211 q = fabs(x: q); /* estimate cancellation error */
212 r = fabs(x: r);
213 if (q > r) r = q;
214 err += err1 + (MACHEP * r) / y;
215
216 y *= gamma(x: c);
217 goto done;
218 } else {
219 /* Psi function expansion, AMS55 #15.3.10, #15.3.11, #15.3.12
220 *
221 * Although AMS55 does not explicitly state it, this expansion fails
222 * for negative integer a or b, since the psi and Gamma functions
223 * involved have poles.
224 */
225
226 if (id >= 0.0) {
227 e = d;
228 d1 = d;
229 d2 = 0.0;
230 aid = id;
231 } else {
232 e = -d;
233 d1 = 0.0;
234 d2 = d;
235 aid = -id;
236 }
237
238 ax = log(x: s);
239
240 /* sum for t = 0 */
241 y = psi(x: 1.0) + psi(x: 1.0 + e) - psi(x: a + d1) - psi(x: b + d1) - ax;
242 y /= gamma(x: e + 1.0);
243
244 p = (a + d1) * (b + d1) * s / gamma(x: e + 2.0); /* Poch for t=1 */
245 t = 1.0;
246 do {
247 r = psi(x: 1.0 + t) + psi(x: 1.0 + t + e) - psi(x: a + t + d1) -
248 psi(x: b + t + d1) - ax;
249 q = p * r;
250 y += q;
251 p *= s * (a + t + d1) / (t + 1.0);
252 p *= (b + t + d1) / (t + 1.0 + e);
253 t += 1.0;
254 if (t > MAX_ITERATIONS) { /* should never happen */
255 sf_error(func_name: "hyp2f1", code: SF_ERROR_SLOW, NULL);
256 *loss = 1.0;
257 return NAN;
258 }
259 } while (y == 0 || fabs(x: q / y) > EPS);
260
261 if (id == 0.0) {
262 y *= gamma(x: c) / (gamma(x: a) * gamma(x: b));
263 goto psidon;
264 }
265
266 y1 = 1.0;
267
268 if (aid == 1) goto nosum;
269
270 t = 0.0;
271 p = 1.0;
272 for (i = 1; i < aid; i++) {
273 r = 1.0 - e + t;
274 p *= s * (a + t + d2) * (b + t + d2) / r;
275 t += 1.0;
276 p /= t;
277 y1 += p;
278 }
279 nosum:
280 p = gamma(x: c);
281 y1 *= gamma(x: e) * p / (gamma(x: a + d1) * gamma(x: b + d1));
282
283 y *= p / (gamma(x: a + d2) * gamma(x: b + d2));
284 if ((aid & 1) != 0) y = -y;
285
286 q = pow(x: s, y: id); /* s to the id power */
287 if (id > 0.0)
288 y *= q;
289 else
290 y1 *= q;
291
292 y += y1;
293 psidon:
294 goto done;
295 }
296 }
297
298 /* Use defining power series if no special cases */
299 y = hys2f1(a, b, c, x, loss: &err);
300
301done:
302 *loss = err;
303 return (y);
304}
305
306/*
307 15.4.2 Abramowitz & Stegun.
308*/
309static double hyp2f1_neg_c_equal_bc(double a, double b, double x) {
310 double k;
311 double collector = 1;
312 double sum = 1;
313 double collector_max = 1;
314
315 if (!(fabs(x: b) < 1e5)) {
316 return NAN;
317 }
318
319 for (k = 1; k <= -b; k++) {
320 collector *= (a + k - 1) * x / k;
321 collector_max = fmax(x: fabs(x: collector), y: collector_max);
322 sum += collector;
323 }
324
325 if (1e-16 * (1 + collector_max / fabs(x: sum)) > 1e-7) {
326 return NAN;
327 }
328
329 return sum;
330}
331
332double hyp2f1(double a, double b, double c, double x) {
333 double d, d1, d2, e;
334 double p, q, r, s, y, ax;
335 double ia, ib, ic, id, err;
336 double t1;
337 int i, aid;
338 int neg_int_a = 0, neg_int_b = 0;
339 int neg_int_ca_or_cb = 0;
340
341 err = 0.0;
342 ax = fabs(x: x);
343 s = 1.0 - x;
344 ia = round(x: a); /* nearest integer to a */
345 ib = round(x: b);
346
347 if (x == 0.0) {
348 return 1.0;
349 }
350
351 d = c - a - b;
352 id = round(x: d);
353
354 if ((a == 0 || b == 0) && c != 0) {
355 return 1.0;
356 }
357
358 if (a <= 0 && fabs(x: a - ia) < EPS) { /* a is a negative integer */
359 neg_int_a = 1;
360 }
361
362 if (b <= 0 && fabs(x: b - ib) < EPS) { /* b is a negative integer */
363 neg_int_b = 1;
364 }
365
366 if (d <= -1 && !(fabs(x: d - id) > EPS && s < 0) && !(neg_int_a || neg_int_b)) {
367 return pow(x: s, y: d) * hyp2f1(a: c - a, b: c - b, c, x);
368 }
369 if (d <= 0 && x == 1 && !(neg_int_a || neg_int_b)) goto hypdiv;
370
371 if (ax < 1.0 || x == -1.0) {
372 /* 2F1(a,b;b;x) = (1-x)**(-a) */
373 if (fabs(x: b - c) < EPS) { /* b = c */
374 if (neg_int_b) {
375 y = hyp2f1_neg_c_equal_bc(a, b, x);
376 } else {
377 y = pow(x: s, y: -a); /* s to the -a power */
378 }
379 goto hypdon;
380 }
381 if (fabs(x: a - c) < EPS) { /* a = c */
382 y = pow(x: s, y: -b); /* s to the -b power */
383 goto hypdon;
384 }
385 }
386
387 if (c <= 0.0) {
388 ic = round(x: c); /* nearest integer to c */
389 if (fabs(x: c - ic) < EPS) { /* c is a negative integer */
390 /* check if termination before explosion */
391 if (neg_int_a && (ia > ic)) goto hypok;
392 if (neg_int_b && (ib > ic)) goto hypok;
393 goto hypdiv;
394 }
395 }
396
397 if (neg_int_a || neg_int_b) /* function is a polynomial */
398 goto hypok;
399
400 t1 = fabs(x: b - a);
401 if (x < -2.0 && fabs(x: t1 - round(x: t1)) > EPS) {
402 /* This transform has a pole for b-a integer, and
403 * may produce large cancellation errors for |1/x| close 1
404 */
405 p = hyp2f1(a, b: 1 - c + a, c: 1 - b + a, x: 1.0 / x);
406 q = hyp2f1(a: b, b: 1 - c + b, c: 1 - a + b, x: 1.0 / x);
407 p *= pow(x: -x, y: -a);
408 q *= pow(x: -x, y: -b);
409 t1 = gamma(x: c);
410 s = t1 * gamma(x: b - a) / (gamma(x: b) * gamma(x: c - a));
411 y = t1 * gamma(x: a - b) / (gamma(x: a) * gamma(x: c - b));
412 return s * p + y * q;
413 } else if (x < -1.0) {
414 if (fabs(x: a) < fabs(x: b)) {
415 return pow(x: s, y: -a) * hyp2f1(a, b: c - b, c, x: x / (x - 1));
416 } else {
417 return pow(x: s, y: -b) * hyp2f1(a: b, b: c - a, c, x: x / (x - 1));
418 }
419 }
420
421 if (ax > 1.0) /* series diverges */
422 goto hypdiv;
423
424 p = c - a;
425 ia = round(x: p); /* nearest integer to c-a */
426 if ((ia <= 0.0) && (fabs(x: p - ia) < EPS)) /* negative int c - a */
427 neg_int_ca_or_cb = 1;
428
429 r = c - b;
430 ib = round(x: r); /* nearest integer to c-b */
431 if ((ib <= 0.0) && (fabs(x: r - ib) < EPS)) /* negative int c - b */
432 neg_int_ca_or_cb = 1;
433
434 id = round(x: d); /* nearest integer to d */
435 q = fabs(x: d - id);
436
437 /* Thanks to Christian Burger <BURGER@DMRHRZ11.HRZ.Uni-Marburg.DE>
438 * for reporting a bug here. */
439 if (fabs(x: ax - 1.0) < EPS) { /* |x| == 1.0 */
440 if (x > 0.0) {
441 if (neg_int_ca_or_cb) {
442 if (d >= 0.0)
443 goto hypf;
444 else
445 goto hypdiv;
446 }
447 if (d <= 0.0) goto hypdiv;
448 y = gamma(x: c) * gamma(x: d) / (gamma(x: p) * gamma(x: r));
449 goto hypdon;
450 }
451 if (d <= -1.0) goto hypdiv;
452 }
453
454 /* Conditionally make d > 0 by recurrence on c
455 * AMS55 #15.2.27
456 */
457 if (d < 0.0) {
458 /* Try the power series first */
459 y = hyt2f1(a, b, c, x, loss: &err);
460 if (err < ETHRESH) goto hypdon;
461 /* Apply the recurrence if power series fails */
462 err = 0.0;
463 aid = 2 - id;
464 e = c + aid;
465 d2 = hyp2f1(a, b, c: e, x);
466 d1 = hyp2f1(a, b, c: e + 1.0, x);
467 q = a + b + 1.0;
468 for (i = 0; i < aid; i++) {
469 r = e - 1.0;
470 y = (e * (r - (2.0 * e - q) * x) * d2 + (e - a) * (e - b) * x * d1) /
471 (e * r * s);
472 e = r;
473 d1 = d2;
474 d2 = y;
475 }
476 goto hypdon;
477 }
478
479 if (neg_int_ca_or_cb) goto hypf; /* negative integer c-a or c-b */
480
481hypok:
482 y = hyt2f1(a, b, c, x, loss: &err);
483
484hypdon:
485 if (err > ETHRESH) {
486 sf_error(func_name: "hyp2f1", code: SF_ERROR_LOSS, NULL);
487 /* printf( "Estimated err = %.2e\n", err ); */
488 }
489 return (y);
490
491 /* The transformation for c-a or c-b negative integer
492 * AMS55 #15.3.3
493 */
494hypf:
495 y = pow(x: s, y: d) * hys2f1(a: c - a, b: c - b, c, x, loss: &err);
496 goto hypdon;
497
498 /* The alarm exit */
499hypdiv:
500 sf_error(func_name: "hyp2f1", code: SF_ERROR_OVERFLOW, NULL);
501 return INFINITY;
502}
503
504/*
505 * Evaluate hypergeometric function by two-term recurrence in `a`.
506 *
507 * This avoids some of the loss of precision in the strongly alternating
508 * hypergeometric series, and can be used to reduce the `a` and `b` parameters
509 * to smaller values.
510 *
511 * AMS55 #15.2.10
512 */
513static double hyp2f1ra(double a, double b, double c, double x, double *loss) {
514 double f2, f1, f0;
515 int n;
516 double t, err, da;
517
518 /* Don't cross c or zero */
519 if ((c < 0 && a <= c) || (c >= 0 && a >= c)) {
520 da = round(x: a - c);
521 } else {
522 da = round(x: a);
523 }
524 t = a - da;
525
526 *loss = 0;
527
528 assert(da != 0);
529
530 if (fabs(x: da) > MAX_ITERATIONS) {
531 /* Too expensive to compute this value, so give up */
532 sf_error(func_name: "hyp2f1", code: SF_ERROR_NO_RESULT, NULL);
533 *loss = 1.0;
534 return NAN;
535 }
536
537 if (da < 0) {
538 /* Recurse down */
539 f2 = 0;
540 f1 = hys2f1(a: t, b, c, x, loss: &err);
541 *loss += err;
542 f0 = hys2f1(a: t - 1, b, c, x, loss: &err);
543 *loss += err;
544 t -= 1;
545 for (n = 1; n < -da; ++n) {
546 f2 = f1;
547 f1 = f0;
548 f0 = -(2 * t - c - t * x + b * x) / (c - t) * f1 -
549 t * (x - 1) / (c - t) * f2;
550 t -= 1;
551 }
552 } else {
553 /* Recurse up */
554 f2 = 0;
555 f1 = hys2f1(a: t, b, c, x, loss: &err);
556 *loss += err;
557 f0 = hys2f1(a: t + 1, b, c, x, loss: &err);
558 *loss += err;
559 t += 1;
560 for (n = 1; n < da; ++n) {
561 f2 = f1;
562 f1 = f0;
563 f0 = -((2 * t - c - t * x + b * x) * f1 + (c - t) * f2) / (t * (x - 1));
564 t += 1;
565 }
566 }
567
568 return f0;
569}
